name: Scions of the Canopy
desc: One of the six tribes of Natlan, also known as Huitztlan. The tribe's people love extreme sports like rock climbing, rappelling, and volcano parkour and live alongside the Yumkasaurs.

imgDesc.text: The settlement of the tribe who live alongside the Yumkasaurs. Their ancestors suspended giant trees here with ropes and grappling hooks, hence the name, "Scions of the Canopy."

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>August 17, 2024</color>
The warriors in the Stadium of the Sacred Flame are about to enter the fray.
While waiting for the competition to begin,
Why not take some time to listen to our three friends share the various facets of their tribal lives?
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>

<color=#ffd780>August 28, 2024</color>
You'll run into all kinds of Saurians during your adventures here in Natlan.
Journey alongside the Saurians and immerse yourself in the breathtaking vistas of Natlan.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>

<color=#ffd780>August 19, 2024</color>
Hello, Traveler!
I've heard that people from a certain tribe really love adventure and sometimes do things that seem quite dangerous to others. Let's learn more about them!

Yupanqui
Hero who stole the Turnfire from the tyrant of the Cinder City,

customize.name: Och-Kan
customize.desc: A dragon mixed with a human soul, the ruler of the Cinder City, known as the Python King and Sacred Lord.

customize.name: Burkina
customize.desc: One of the six heroes of Natlan who bore the Ancient NameHe died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago at the hands of his companion.

customize.text: Hero of the tribe who died in the

customize.name: Khaenri'ahn cataclysm
customize.desc: A disaster that occurred 500 years ago. The Abyss was released into Teyvat and Khaenri'ah was destroyed.

customize.name: Gluttonous Yumkasaur Mountain King
customize.desc:
A powerful Yumkasaur that has survived both the ravages of time and countless battles, surviving until the present day.
This "Mountain King," who once joined forces with the great heroes against the Black Tide, holds a special place in the hearts of the Scions of the Canopy. Some tribe members believe that it has its current body shape because it has a unique physique, like the Qucusaurus "Tyrant"... Though in fact, this is simply because it's lived for so long, and eaten way, WAY too much.

customize.name: Mavuika
customize.desc: The leader of Natlan who inherited the Ancient Name of "Kiongozi." She made a vow to illuminate the future of the nation of war with the Sacred Flame.

customize.text: The current Pyro Archon who has the Ancient Name

customize.name: Wayna
customize.desc: Chief of the Scions of the Canopy.

customize.name: Kinich
customize.desc: A Huitztlan Saurian Hunter skilled at counting costs.

customize.text:
Saurian hunter. He is a hero of the Scions of the Canopy, who has been acknowledged by his Ancient Name
Vichama
Legendary warrior and scout of the tribe. He died in the Abyss invasion.
Mallko
Tribal warrior and Vichama's close friend. He died in the Night Warden Wars.

customize.name: Coatepec Mountain
customize.desc: The settlement of the tribe who live alongside the Yumkasaurs. Their ancestors suspended giant trees here with ropes and grappling hooks, hence the name, "Scions of the Canopy."

customize.name: Yumkasaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with powerful hind legs and a fluffy tail, capable of spitting Flamegranate pectin hidden in their cheek pouches out, wrapping around distant objects.
According to legend, the original Yumkasaurs were not at all like today, but much smaller, so small that they were difficult even to see. They could roam freely with the wind, cling to the bodies of the massive dragons, or gather in groups to move about like clouds. However, in order to maintain their form after their abilities degenerated, they had no choice but to assume their current shape.

customize.name: Yumkasaur Whelp
customize.desc:
A young Yumkasaurus with the ability to spit Flamegranate pectin hidden in their cheek pouches out, wrapping around distant objects.
Their hold on pectin-coated objects isn't strong enough, nor is their sense of balance good enough to allow them to move freely through the air. Sometimes, they'll even fall over to one side just sitting on their tails. However, one day, they will grow into the form that can swing freely between the trees without a care.

customize.name: Fang of the Mountain King
customize.desc: A giant sword forged from pure turquoise. Due to its greater weight than most ordinary weapons, it was named for Kongomato the Mountain King.

customize.name: Earth Shaker
customize.desc: A heavy blade that people claim was beloved by the hero known as the Firethief. They say that even the Lord of Cinder Keep's flames could not burn it away.

customize.name: Fruitful Hook
customize.desc: Bold Burkina from the Scions of the Canopy once made this weapon with the hero Tenoch's help — all for the sake of obtaining Flamegranates unmatched throughout Natlan.

customize.name: Talking Stick
customize.desc: Most people will find this obsidian-inlaid club quite convincing indeed.

customize.name: Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City
Green Obsidian Ring
customize.desc: An obsidian ring with engraved patterns styled like those of the Scions of the Canopy. It is an ancient medium by which the tribe established contact with the deep night. Perhaps its strength can allow you to cross the boundary between this place and a certain other location...

customize.name: "Scions of the Canopy" Reputation EXP
customize.desc: Increases your Tribe Reputation Lv. (Scions of the Canopy)

customize.name: Puff Pops
customize.desc: A snack with lots of different flavors. If you close your eyes, you won't be able to guess what flavor you'll get next, and eating them is sure to increase your heart rate — and that's what makes this popular amongst the Scions of the Canopy. By the way, the "pop" part of the name comes from the sound of Grainfruit kernels bursting open under high temperatures.
